title: Treat Foot Blisters Safely
brief: Properly manage foot blisters to prevent infection while maintaining mobility.
steps: Step 1: For small blisters - do not open them. Leave intact blisters safe from infection.
Step 2: Apply padding material around small blisters to relieve pressure and reduce friction.
Step 3: For large blisters - obtain a clean sewing needle and sterilized thread.
Step 4: Run the needle and thread completely through the large blister.
Step 5: Remove needle but leave both ends of thread hanging out of the blister.
Step 6: Allow thread to absorb liquid inside, reducing blister size while keeping hole open.
Step 7: Pad around the treated blister to prevent further pressure.
Step 8: If blister bursts naturally, treat as open wound with daily cleaning and dressing.
warnings: Never completely drain large blisters - this increases infection risk.
If blister becomes red, swollen, or produces pus, it may be infected.
